00912BOS02-d-09-12-90-ATK.Accident Cause: Other causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
00912BOS02-d-09-12-90-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN 495 WAS PROCEDING SOUTH ON SINGLE TRACK AND HAD PASSED M.P. 23.0. IT WAS DAYLIGHT, OVERCAST WITH GOOD VISIBILITY, TANGENT TRACK WITH A SLIGHT UPGRADE. APPROACHING M.P. 22.5 IDENTIFIED AS FISH POND ROAD (ALSO KNOWN AS MINK FARM ROAD) A PICK UP TRUCK DROVE ONTO THIS PRIVATE CROSSING. THE TRUCK STOPPED THEN BACKED APPPROXIMATELY FOUR FEET AND STOPPED AGAIN JUST PRIOR TO IMPACT. THE OPERATOR OFTHE VEHICLE PUT HANDS UP TO FACE JUST PRIOR TO COLLISION. THE TRUCK WAS THROWN SOUTH AND WEST OF THECROSSING SITE AND THE VEHICLE OPERATOR WAS EJECTED FROM THE VEHICLE AND FATALLY INJURED. THE TRAVELTRAVELLED 2093 FEET WITH BRAKES APPLIED IN FULL EMERGENCY. SUBSTANTIAL DAMAGE WAS CAUSED TO THE PLOW, 480 VOLT CABLE RECEPTACLES, CAB SIGNAL PICK UP BARS, AND RELATED APPLIANCES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
